alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... that in certain ways, the portions of the fluid transmuted into gross matter can be acted upon by the primary fluid which remains imponderable or very light, but that these ways differ very much from those in which one part of gross matter acts upon another; that the transmutation of the primary fluid into gross matter, or of gross matter into primary fluid, is a creative action wholly denied to us; the sum of each remaining constant.'"
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - A Definition of Aether - Part 2
